item.description:
WEATHER UPDATE, 7/20 8 AM: The forecast is a little iffy, but scattered, so let's give it a try! I'll bring our canopy and a tarp just in case.

Let's have a mid-summer picnic! We'll be on the Eastern Prom, at the picnic area near the beach. (Map) We'll have a grill, you can bring something for yourself to grill and a salad or dessert to share. We'll provide the drinks or bring your own, no alcohol please. Family and friends welcome!!

We'll probably be there for at least a couple of hours. A small group of intrepid souls are planning to ride 50 miles on the Eastern Trail from Wells to Portland that morning, and hope to arrive back in town in time to meet us there, so we'll keep some dogs on for them. Others may wish to meet up with Steve Gordon's weekly ride, starting just across the Back Cove at Payson Park at 2 pm, or just take your own ride around the Eastern Prom Trail.

If enough people are interested, there are some fun bike handling contests we could do in the parking lot:
  • Fastest from Point A to Point B.
  • Slowest from Point A to Point B without putting a foot down (more challenging).
  • Shortest stopping distance from cruising speed. (Including teaching you how to NOT go over the handlebars!)
  • Riding the straightest line (any speed)



I'd be glad to donate some blinkie lights and Bicycling Street Smarts booklets as prizes. (THESE WILL ALSO BE AVAILABLE FOR SALE.)

Those not on bikes might choose to walk along the Eastern Prom to multiple destinations like Fish Point, or check out the Narrow Gauge RailRoad Museum and/or catch a ride on their train. Or other fun stuff includes checking out the view from Fort Allen, taking a swim at East End Beach, doing a little fishing off one of the old piers, or taking your kayak or other small boat out to Fort Gorges.

Rain plan: In case of inclement weather, we'll post here by 10 AM that morning if we're cancelling.
item.name: Pedal Potluck Picnic
